Text saved: Most people think poor countries are in a very bad situation.
They think these countries have much poverty.
Bad leaders rule them.
People think there is little hope for good change.
But this is not true.
A big change is happening.
In the last 20 years, 700 million people got more money.
They are not poor now.
Also, six million less children die from sickness every year.
Many more girls go to school.
Many people now have clean water.

Additionally, there is a grammatical error in the sentence 'six million less children die from sickness every year'. For countable nouns like 'children', the correct word is 'fewer', not 'less'. While 'less' is an A2 word, its incorrect application demonstrates a lack of grammatical precision required even at the A2 level. Suggestion: Replace 'much poverty' with 'not much money' or 'being very poor'. Correct 'less children' to 'fewer children'.
